018package org.tquadrat.foundation.util.internal;
019
020import static java.util.Arrays.stream;
021import static java.util.stream.Collectors.joining;
022import static java.util.stream.Stream.builder;
023import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.INTERNAL;
024import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.isNull;
025import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.nonNull;
026import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
027import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNotEmptyArgument;
028import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.format;
029import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.isEmptyOrBlank;
030import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.isNotEmptyOrBlank;
031
032import java.io.BufferedReader;
033import java.io.IOException;
034import java.io.InputStreamReader;
035import java.net.URL;
036import java.util.Map;
037import java.util.Optional;
038import java.util.TreeMap;
039import java.util.function.Supplier;
040import java.util.stream.Stream;
041import java.util.stream.Stream.Builder;
042
043import org.apiguardian.api.API;
044import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
045import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.UnexpectedExceptionError;
046import org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Lazy;
047import org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils;

049/**
050 *  Provides HTML and XML entity utilities.
051 *
052 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
053 *  @thanks Alexander Day Chaffee - alex@purpletech.com
054 *  @thanks Gary Gregory - ggregory@seagullsw.com
055 *  @inspired Some code I found somewhere long time ago, originally written by
056 *      Alexander Day Chaffee and Gary Gregory
057 *  @version $Id: Entities.java 980 2022-01-06 15:29:19Z tquadrat $
058 *  @since 0.0.5
059 *
060 *  @see <a href="http://hotwired.lycos.com/webmonkey/reference/special_characters/">ISO Entities</a>
061 *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html32#latin1">HTML 3.2 Character Entities for ISO Latin-1</a>
062 *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/sgml/entities.html">HTML 4.0 Character entity references</a>
063 *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/charset.html#h-5.3">HTML 4.01 Character References</a>
064 *  @see <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/charset.html#code-position">HTML 4.01 Code positions</a>
065 *  @see <a href="https://www.quackit.com/character_sets/html5_entities/html5_entities_all.cfm">HTML5 Entities in Alphabetical Order - Complete List</a>
066 *
067 *  @UMLGraph.link
068 */
069@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: Entities.java 980 2022-01-06 15:29:19Z tquadrat $" )
070@API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
071public final class Entities
072{
073        /*---------------*\
074    ====** Inner Classes **====================================================
075        \*---------------*/
076    /**
077     *  Local interface for the data structure that is used to store the
078     *  entity mappings.
079     *
080     *  @extauthor Alexander Day Chaffee - alex@purpletech.com
081     *  @extauthor Gary Gregory - ggregory@seagullsw.com
082     *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
083     *  @version $Id: Entities.java 980 2022-01-06 15:29:19Z tquadrat $
084     *  @since 0.0.5
085     *
086     *  @UMLGraph.link
087     */
088    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: Entities.java 980 2022-01-06 15:29:19Z tquadrat $" )
089    private static interface EntityMap
090    {
091            /*---------*\
092        ====** Methods **======================================================
093            \*---------*/
094        /**
095         *  Adds an entry to this entity map.<br>
096         *  <br>If the value is negative, only the name to value relation will
097         *  be stored.
098         *
099         *  @param  name    The entity name.
100         *  @param  value   The entity value (the Unicode code).
101         */
102        public void add( String name, Integer value );
103
104        /**
105         *  Returns the entities.
106         *
107         *  @return The entities.
108         */
109        public Stream<String> list();
110
111        /**
112         *  Returns the name of the entity identified by the specified value.
113         *
114         *  @param  value   The value to locate.
115         *  @return An instance of
116         *      {@link Optional}
117         *      that holds the entity name that is associated with the
118         *      specified value.
119         */
120        public Optional<String> name( int value );
121
122        /**
123         *  Returns the value of the entity identified by the specified name.
124         *
125         *  @param  name    The name of the entity to locate
126         *  @return An instance of
127         *      {@link Optional}
128         *      that holds the entity value associated with the specified name.
129         */
130        public Optional<Integer> value( String name );
131    }
132    //  interface EntityMap
133
134    /**
135     *  A simple implementation for the interface
136     *  {@link EntityMap}.
137     *
138     *  @extauthor Alexander Day Chaffee - alex@purpletech.com
139     *  @extauthor Gary Gregory - ggregory@seagullsw.com
140     *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
141     *  @version $Id: Entities.java 980 2022-01-06 15:29:19Z tquadrat $
142     *  @since 0.0.5
143     *
144     *  @UMLGraph.link
145     */
146    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: Entities.java 980 2022-01-06 15:29:19Z tquadrat $" )
147    private static class PrimitiveEntityMap implements EntityMap
148    {
149            /*------------*\
150        ====** Attributes **===================================================
151            \*------------*/
152        /**
153         *  The map that holds the references from the name to the value.
154         */
155        private final Map<String,Integer> m_NameToValue = new TreeMap<>();
156
157        /**
158         *  The map that holds the references from the value to the name.
159         */
160        private final Map<Integer,String> m_ValueToName = new TreeMap<>();
161
162            /*--------------*\
163        ====** Constructors **=================================================
164            \*--------------*/
165        /**
166         *  Creates a new primitive entity map.
167         */
168        public PrimitiveEntityMap() { /* Does nothing but exist */ }
169
170            /*---------*\
171        ====** Methods **======================================================
172            \*---------*/
173        /**
174         * {@inheritDoc}
175         */
176        @Override
177        public final void add( final String name, final Integer value )
178        {
179            assert isNotEmptyOrBlank( name ) : "name is empty or null";
180            assert nonNull( value ) : "value is null";
181            assert value.intValue() != 0 : "value is 0";
182
183            if( value.intValue() > 0 )
184            {
185                m_NameToValue.put( name, value );
186                final var previousName = m_ValueToName.put( value, name );
187                assert isNull( previousName ) : format( "Duplicate: %s, %s, %d", name, previousName, value );
188            }
189            else
190            {
191                m_NameToValue.put( name, Integer.valueOf( -value.intValue() ) );
192            }
193        }   //  add()
194
195        /**
196         * {@inheritDoc}
197         */
198        @Override
199        public final Stream<String> list() { return m_NameToValue.keySet().stream(); }
200
201        /**
202         * {@inheritDoc}
203         */
204        @Override
205        public final Optional<String> name( final int value ) { return Optional.ofNullable( m_ValueToName.get( value ) ); }
206
207        /**
208         * {@inheritDoc}
209         */
210        @Override
211        public final Optional<Integer> value( final String name )
212        {
213            final var retValue = Optional.ofNullable( m_NameToValue.get( requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" ) ) );
214
215            //---* Done *------------------------------------------------------
216            return retValue;
217        }   //  value()
218    }
219    //  class PrimitiveEntityMap
220
221        /*-----------*\
222    ====** Constants **========================================================
223        \*-----------*/
224    /**
225     *  The name for the resource file that holds the additional XML entities:
226     *  {@value}. These entities are not defined for HTML before HTML&nbsp;5.
227     */
228    public static final String ADDITIONAL_XML_ENTITIES = "apos_entities.data";
229
230    /**
231     *  The name for the resource file that holds the basic entities that are
232     *  common for both XML and HTML: {@value}.
233     */
234    public static final String BASIC_ENTITIES = "basic_entities.data";
235
236    /**
237     *  The name for the resource final that holds the entities that were
238     *  introduced for HTML&nbsp;3.2: {@value}.
239     */
240    public static final String HTML32_ENTITIES = "ISO8859_1_entities.data";
241
242    /**
243     *  The name for the resource final that holds the entities that were
244     *  introduced for HTML&nbsp;4.0: {@value}.
245     */
246    public static final String HTML40_ENTITIES = "html40_entities.data";
247
248    /**
249     *  The name for the resource final that holds the entities that were
250     *  introduced for HTML&nbsp;5.0: {@value}.
251     */
252    public static final String HTML50_ENTITIES = "html50_entities.data";
253
254        /*------------*\
255    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
256        \*------------*/
257    /**
258     *  The entity mapping.
259     */
260    private final Lazy<EntityMap> m_EntityMap;
261
262        /*------------------------*\
263    ====** Static Initialisations **===========================================
264        \*------------------------*/
265    /**
266     *  The set of basic entities.
267     */
268    public static final Entities BASIC;
269
270    /**
271     *  The set of entities supported by HTML 3.2.
272     */
273    public static final Entities HTML32;
274
275    /**
276     *  The set of entities supported by HTML 4.0.
277     */
278    public static final Entities HTML40;
279
280    /**
281     *  The set of entities supported by HTML 5.0.
282     */
283    public static final Entities HTML50;
284
285    /**
286     *  The set of entities supported by standard XML.
287     */
288    public static final Entities XML;
289
290    static
291    {
292        //---* Set the BASIC entities *----------------------------------------
293        BASIC = new Entities( BASIC_ENTITIES );
294
295        //---* Set the HTML 3.2 entities *-------------------------------------
296        HTML32 = new Entities( BASIC_ENTITIES, HTML32_ENTITIES );
297
298        //---* Set the HTML 4.0 entities *-------------------------------------
299        HTML40 = new Entities( BASIC_ENTITIES, HTML32_ENTITIES, HTML40_ENTITIES );
300
301        //---* Set the HTML 5.0 entities *-------------------------------------
302        HTML50 = new Entities( BASIC_ENTITIES, HTML32_ENTITIES, HTML40_ENTITIES, HTML50_ENTITIES );
303
304        //---* Set the HTML XML entities *-------------------------------------
305        XML = new Entities( BASIC_ENTITIES, ADDITIONAL_XML_ENTITIES );
306    }
307
308        /*--------------*\
309    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
310        \*--------------*/
311    /**
312     *  Creates a new {@code Entities} instance.
313     *
314     *  @param  resourceNames   The names of the resource files with the entity
315     *      definitions.
316     */
317    private Entities( final String... resourceNames )
318    {
319        final var thisClass = getClass();
320        final var packageName = thisClass.getPackageName().replace( '.', '/' );
321        final var resourceURLs = stream( resourceNames )
322            .map( n ->
323            {
324                final var resourceName = format( "/%s/%s", packageName, n );
325                final var resourceURL = thisClass.getResource( resourceName );
326                assert nonNull( resourceURL ) : format( "URL is null for %s", resourceName );
327                return resourceURL;
328            } )
329            .toArray( URL []::new );
330
331        final var supplier = (Supplier<EntityMap>) () ->
332        {
333            final EntityMap map = new PrimitiveEntityMap();
334            for( final var resourceURL : resourceURLs )
335            {
336                loadEntities( map, resourceURL );
337            }
338            return map;
339        };
340
341        m_EntityMap = Lazy.use( supplier );
342    }   //  Entities()
343
344        /*---------*\
345    ====** Methods **==========================================================
346        \*---------*/
347    /**
348     *  Underlying unescape method that allows the optimisation of not starting
349     *  from the 0 index again.
350     *
351     *  @param  buffer  The buffer to write the results to.
352     *  @param  s   The source {@code String} to unescape.
353     *  @param  firstAmp    The index of the first ampersand in the source.
354     *  @throws IOException Problems on writing to the {@code buffer}.
355     */
356    @SuppressWarnings( "MagicNumber" )
357    private void doUnescape( final Appendable buffer, final CharSequence s, final int firstAmp ) throws IOException
358    {
359        assert nonNull( buffer ) : "buffer is null";
360        assert nonNull( s ) : "s is null";
361        assert firstAmp >= 0 : "firstAmp is less than 0";
362
363        buffer.append( s, 0, firstAmp );
364        final var str = s.toString();
365        final var len = str.length();
366        char c, isHexChar;
367        int nextIndex, semiColonIndex, ampersandIndex, entityContentLen;
368        Optional<Integer> entityValue;
369        ScanLoop: for( var i = firstAmp; i < len; ++i )
370        {
371            c = str.charAt( i );
372            if( c == '&' )
373            {
374                nextIndex = i + 1;
375                semiColonIndex = str.indexOf( ';', nextIndex );
376                if( semiColonIndex == -1 )
377                {
378                    buffer.append( c );
379                    continue ScanLoop;
380                }
381                ampersandIndex = str.indexOf( '&', i + 1 );
382                if( (ampersandIndex != -1) && (ampersandIndex < semiColonIndex) )
383                {
384                    //---* The text looks like "&...&...;" *-------------------
385                    buffer.append( c );
386                    continue ScanLoop;
387                }
388                final var entityContent = str.substring( nextIndex, semiColonIndex );
389                entityValue = Optional.empty();
390                entityContentLen = entityContent.length();
391                if( entityContentLen > 0 )
392                {
393                    if( entityContent.charAt( 0 ) == '#' )
394                    {
395                        /*
396                         * Escaped value content is an integer (decimal or
397                         * hexadecimal)
398                         */
399                        if( entityContentLen > 1 )
400                        {
401                            isHexChar = entityContent.charAt( 1 );
402                            try
403                            {
404                                final var value = switch( isHexChar )
405                                {
406                                    case 'X', 'x' -> Integer.parseInt( entityContent.substring( 2 ), 0x10 );
407                                    default -> Integer.parseInt( entityContent.substring( 1 ), 10 );
408                                };
409                                entityValue = value > 0xFFFFFF ? Optional.empty() : Optional.of( Integer.valueOf( value ) );
410                            }
411                            catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final NumberFormatException e )
412                            {
413                                entityValue = Optional.empty();
414                            }
415                        }
416                    }
417                    else
418                    {
419                        //---* Escaped value content is an entity name *-------
420                        entityValue = entityValue( entityContent );
421                    }
422                }
423                buffer.append( entityValue.map( v -> Character.toString( v.intValue() ) ).orElseGet( () -> format( "&%s;", entityContent ) ) );
424
425                //---* Move  the index up to the semi-colon *------------------
426                //noinspection AssignmentToForLoopParameter
427                i = semiColonIndex;
428            }
429            else
430            {
431                buffer.append( c );
432            }
433        }   //  ScanLoop:
434    }   //  doUnescape()
435
436    /**
437     *  Returns the name of the entity identified by the specified value.
438     *
439     *  @param  value   The value to locate.
440     *  @return An instance of
441     *      {@link Optional}
442     *      that holds the entity name that is associated with the specified
443     *      value.
444     */
445    public final Optional<String> entityName( final int value ) { return m_EntityMap.get().name( value ); }
446
447    /**
448     *  Returns the value of the entity identified by the specified name.
449     *
450     *  @param  name    The name to locate.
451     *  @return An instance of
452     *      {@link Optional}
453     *      that holds the entity value associated with the specified name.
454     */
455    public final Optional<Integer> entityValue( final String name ) { return m_EntityMap.get().value( name ); }
456
457    /**
458     *  Escapes the characters in a {@code String}.<br>
459     *  <br>For example, if you have called
460     *  {@code addEntity( "foo", "0xA1" )}, a call to
461     *  {@code escape( "\u00A1" )} will return {@code "&foo;"}.
462     *
463     *  @param  str The {@code String} to escape.
464     *  @return A new escaped {@code String}.
465     */
466    public final String escape( final CharSequence str )
467    {
468        final var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( str, "str" ).codePoints()
469            .mapToObj( c -> entityName( c ).map( n -> format( "&%s;", n ) ).orElseGet( () -> c > 0x7F ? formatCodePoint( c ) : Character.toString( (char) c ) ) )
470            .collect( joining() );
471
472        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
473        return retValue;
474    }   //  escape()
475
476    /**
477     *  Escapes the characters in the {@code String} passed and writes the
478     *  result to the
479     *  {@link Appendable}
480     *  passed.
481     *
482     *  @param  appendable  The {@code Appendable} to write the results of the
483     *      escaping to.
484     *  @param  str The {@code String} to escape.
485     *  @throws IOException when {@code Appendable} passed throws the exception
486     *      from calls to the
487     *      {@link Appendable#append(char)}
488     *      method.
489     *  @see #escape(CharSequence)
490     */
491    public final void escape( final Appendable appendable, final CharSequence str ) throws IOException
492    {
493        requireNonNullArgument( appendable, "appendable" ).append( escape( requireNonNullArgument( str, "str" ) ) );
494    }   //  escape()
495
496    /**
497     *  Converts a code point into the numerical HTML escape format.
498     *
499     *  @param  codePoint   The code point.
500     *  @return The HTML escaped code point.
501     */
502    private static final String formatCodePoint( final int codePoint )
503    {
504        final Builder<String> builder = builder();
505        for( final var c : Character.toChars( codePoint ) )
506        {
507            builder.add( format( "&#x%X;", (int) c ) );
508        }
509        final var retValue = builder.build().collect( joining() );
510
511        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
512        return retValue;
513    }   //  formatCodePoint()
514
515    /**
516     *  Returns a list of all known entities.
517     *
518     *  @return An array of String with the entities, there numerical values
519     *      and the Unicode name of the entity.
520     */
521    public final String [] listEntities()
522    {
523        final var retValue = m_EntityMap.get().list()
524            .sorted()
525            .map( e ->
526            {
527                /*
528                 * For all existing entities, entityValue() will return a
529                 * value, so that the check on presence is obsolete.
530                 */
531                @SuppressWarnings( "OptionalGetWithoutIsPresent" )
532                final var value = entityValue( e ).get().intValue();
533                final var unicode = Character.getName( value );
534                return format( "&%1$s; = &#%2$d = &#%2$X%3$s", e, value, isEmptyOrBlank( unicode ) ? "" : format( " (%s)", unicode ) );
535            } )
536            .toArray( String []::new );
537
538        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
539        return retValue;
540    }   //  listEntities()
541
542    /**
543     *  Load the entities from the resource identified by the given URL to the
544     *  given target entity map.
545     *
546     *  @param  entityMap   The map that is the target for the entities.
547     *  @param  resourceURL The URL for the resource.
548     */
549    @SuppressWarnings( "ProhibitedExceptionThrown" )
550    private static void loadEntities( final EntityMap entityMap, final URL resourceURL )
551    {
552        assert nonNull( entityMap ) : "entityMap is null";
553        assert nonNull( resourceURL ) : "resourceURL is null";
554
555        try( final var reader = new BufferedReader( new InputStreamReader( resourceURL.openStream() ) ) )
556        {
557            reader.lines()
558                .filter( StringUtils::isNotEmptyOrBlank )
559                .filter( l -> !l.startsWith( "#" ) )
560                .forEach( l -> parseAndAdd( entityMap, l ) );
561        }
562        catch( final IOException e )
563        {
564            throw new Error( "Failed to read resource " + resourceURL, e );
565        }
566    }   //  loadEntities()
567
568    /**
569     *  Parses the given input line for an entity name and the related code
570     *  point, and adds both to the given entity map.
571     *
572     *  @param  entityMap   The map that is the target for the entities.
573     *  @param  inputLine   The input line.
574     */
575    @SuppressWarnings( "ProhibitedExceptionThrown" )
576    private static void parseAndAdd( final EntityMap entityMap, final String inputLine )
577    {
578        //---* Strip the comment *---------------------------------------------
579        var pos = inputLine.indexOf( "#" );
580        final var data = (pos < 0 ? inputLine : inputLine.substring( 0, pos )).trim();
581
582        //---* Split the data *------------------------------------------------
583        pos = data.indexOf( "=" );
584        if( pos < 0 ) throw new Error( "Invalid input data: " + inputLine );
585        final var entityName = data.substring( 0, pos ).trim();
586        final var value = data.substring( pos + 1 ).trim();
587        try
588        {
589            final var codePoint = Integer.valueOf( value );
590            entityMap.add( entityName, codePoint );
591        }
592        catch( final NumberFormatException e )
593        {
594            throw new Error( "Invalid input data: " + inputLine, e );
595        }
596    }   //  parseAndAdd()
597
598    /**
599     *  Unescapes the entities in a {@code String}.<br>
600     *  <br>For example, if you have called {@code addEntity( "foo", 0xA1 )},
601     *  a call to {@code unescape( "&foo;")} will return {@code "\u00A1"}.
602     *
603     *  @param  str The {@code String} to escape.
604     *  @return A new escaped {@code String}.
605     */
606    public final String unescape( final CharSequence str )
607    {
608        var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( str, "str" ).toString();
609        final var firstAmp = retValue.indexOf( '&' );
610        if( firstAmp >= 0 )
611        {
612            final var buffer = new StringBuilder( str.length() * 2 );
613            try
614            {
615                doUnescape( buffer, str, firstAmp );
616            }
617            catch( final IOException e )
618            {
619                /*
620                 * Operations on a StringBuilder should not cause an
621                 * IOException.
622                 */
623                throw new UnexpectedExceptionError( e );
624            }
625            retValue = buffer.toString();
626        }
627
628        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
629        return retValue;
630    }   //  unescape()
631
632    /**
633     *  Unescapes the escaped entities in the {@code String} passed and writes
634     *  the result to the
635     *  {@link Appendable}
636     *  passed.
637     *
638     *  @param  appendable  The {@code Appendable} to write the results to.
639     *  @param  str The source {@code String} to unescape.
640     *  @throws IOException when {@code Appendable} passed throws the exception
641     *      from calls to the
642     *      {@link Appendable#append(char)}
643     *      method.
644     *  @see #unescape(CharSequence)
645     */
646    public final void unescape( final Appendable appendable, final CharSequence str ) throws IOException
647    {
648        final var firstAmp = requireNonNullArgument( str, "str" ).toString().indexOf( "&" );
649        if( firstAmp >= 0 )
650        {
651            doUnescape( requireNonNullArgument( appendable, "appendable" ), str, firstAmp );
652        }
653        else
654        {
655            requireNonNullArgument( appendable, "appendable" ).append( str );
656        }
657    }   //  unescape()
658}
659//  class Entities
660
661/*
662 *  End of File
663 */
